channel.title: [PI] SkillCape shop glitch
channel.description: Hello there, i've recently started using my InsidiaX Source again and I saw that it has the skillcape glitch in it.... When you try to talk to the wise old man, he suddenly freezes you, and your whole screen is stuck. I've never really done this myself before, i've heard bout the bug though. Here's what I get, when I click on him and everything freezes: http://prntscr.com/73b1t3 Any and every bit of help is greatly appreciated.

item.title: [PI] SkillCape shop glitch
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:551431”]The error is 1 of 2 things:

  1. You don’t have the model in your client, so it’s trying to display it and creates a null pointer. This can be caused by bad model ids or bad item ids.

  2. This I guess? http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/snippets/338568-pi-skillcape-shop-client-crash-fix.html[/quote]
    Tried the second option out, didn’t work.
    Now, How would I check if I have the models for it or not? and if not, how do I add it?

EDIT: SOLVEDD! Easy solution …

[CODE]

go to:ItemDef.Java
Search for;
[totalItems + 5000]

Change 5000 to 50000
and it worked!
[/CODE]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] SkillCape shop glitch

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The error is 1 of 2 things:

  1. You don’t have the model in your client, so it’s trying to display it and creates a null pointer. This can be caused by bad model ids or bad item ids.

  2. This I guess? http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/snippets/338568-pi-skillcape-shop-client-crash-fix.html

Hello there, i’ve recently started using my InsidiaX Source again and I saw that it has the skillcape glitch in it… When you try to talk to the wise old man, he suddenly freezes you, and your whole screen is stuck.
